valItem.desc: an expression evaluating to content to process as alternative version (eg. for reg/orig pairs wrapped in choice); used with the alternate behaviour

an expression evaluating to content to process by a behaviour (used with all behaviours with the exception of alternate and omit); when this parameter is not explicitly given for a model, current element may be used as default value
an expression evaluating to content to process as default, similar to the content but used to distinguish from alternate behaviour
an expression evaluating to content which could be used as a value for height, for example to specify the height of a graphic, e.g. "300px", "50%". This is used with the graphic behaviour
an expression that should evaluate to content that could be used as identifiers for an anchor; used for anchor behaviour
an expression evaluating to content that could be used as label, for example for breaks or footnote references (eg. concat('Page ', @n)) for note or break behaviours
an expression evaluating to a positive integer, for example used with the heading behaviour to specify its structural level
an expression evaluating to content to be used as URL for hyperlink generated with the link behaviour

an expression evaluating to content that describes the placement of some text (e.g. a footnote); used with the note behaviour; sample values include: "margin", "footnote", "endnote", "inline", "bottom"

an expression evaluating to text which specifies a classification of the behaviour being documented, for example the kind of break (when used with the break behaviour) or kind of index to generate (if used with the index behaviour)
an expression evaluating to a url, for example the source of a graphic; used with the graphic behaviour

valList.valItem: an expression evaluating to content which could be used as a value for height, for example to specify the height of a graphic, e.g. "300px", "50%". This is used with the graphic behaviour valItem>

attDef.desc: supplies an XPath expression used as the value for a parameter

remarks.p: The content of parameter is an XPath expression. The names and datatypes of the expected parameters should be documented in the corresponding customization using a paramSpec element. Literal strings provided in an XPath expression should be quoted.
